- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell

$s = New-PSSession "PC-01"
$folder = "\\PC-01\Daten\pitu\38"
$myjob = invoke-command -session $s -scriptblock {New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path "\\PC-01\Daten\pitu\38"} -asjob
$myjob | wait-job

$myjob

"Invoke Test-Path in Remote:"
$vico = invoke-command -session $s -scriptblock { Test-Path -Path "\\PC-01\Daten\pitu\38"}  
$vico

"Test-Path 1:"
Test-Path $('filesystem::'+$folder)

"Test-Path 2:"
Test-Path -path $folder

"System IO Exist:"
[System.IO.Directory]::Exists($folder);


#Sleep 10 Seconds
Start-Sleep -Seconds 10

"Test-Path 1:"
Test-Path $('filesystem::'+$folder)

"Test-Path 2:"
Test-Path -path $folder

"System IO Exist:"
[System.IO.Directory]::Exists($folder); 

```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Folder is created but Test-Path  output is "FALSE" but  after some seconds (10 sec in example) then output ist "True"

When i make a invoke with Test-Path is correct output (TRUE)

```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Invoke Test-Path in Remote:
True
Test-Path 1:
False
Test-Path 2:
False
System IO Exist:
False
(Sleep 10 Seconds)
Test-Path 1:
True
Test-Path 2:
True
System IO Exist:
True
```

I'm wondering why test-path is returning true and false with two statements, can anyone explain or suggest why?

$app2find = "Easeus"

### search ###
$appSearch = Get-ChildItem -Path HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall, HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall  |
    Get-ItemProperty |
        Where-Object {$_.DisplayName -match $app2find } |
            Select-Object -Property DisplayName, UninstallString

### search results ###
if (!$appSearch) { "No apps named like $app2find were found" }

### uninstall ###
ForEach ($app in $appSearch) {

    If ($app.UninstallString) {

        Test-Path $app.UninstallString
        Test-Path "C:\Program Files (x86)\EaseUS\EaseUS Partition Master 10.5\unins000.exe"

        #& cmd /c $($app.UninstallString) /silent
    }
}
